required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Psychodynamic Internet Treatment Versus Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) for Generalized Anxiety Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Psychodynamic Versus Cognitive Behavioral Internet-Delivered Guided Self-help for Generalized Anxiety Disorder: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to test if Internet-delivered cognitive behavior therapy (iCBT) or Internet-delivered psychodynamic therapy (iPDT) performs better for a population with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), compared to a wait-list control condition.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a non-inferiority trial within the context of a parallel group study with unrestricted randomisation in 1:1:1 ratio conducted in Sweden. Outcome assessors were blind to treatment status.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in anxiety symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale-Self Rated (MADRS-S)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in depressive symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in quality of life status to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in depressive symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in anxiety symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trimbos and iMTA questionnaire on Costs associated with Psychiatric illness (TIC-P)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in societal cost of illness to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in anxiety symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Generalized Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire IV (GAD-Q IV)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks pre treatment to two weeks post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in anxiety symptoms to two weeks post treatment.

arm_group.description: Active treatment: Internet-delivered Cognitive Behavior Therapy, 8 weeks treatment, guided self-help
Active treatment: Internet-delivered Psychodynamic Therapy Active treatment: Internet-delivered Psychodynamic Therapy, 8 weeks treatment, guided self-help
Wait-list condition, received treatment 3 months after initial treatment period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- fulfill the diagnostic criteria for GAD according to DSM-IV
- have access to the Internet
- have good knowledge of the Swedish language
Exclusion Criteria:
- recent (during last 6 weeks) change in psychiatric medication
- presently in any other psychological treatment
- severe depression
- suicidal ideation
